Authors: Seonju Lee, Michael J Wingfield, Pedro W. Crous
Title:
Pestalotioid fungi from Restionaceae in the Cape Floral
Kingdom
Abstract:
Eight pestalotioid fungi were isolated from the
Restionaceae growing in the Cape Floral Kingdom of South Africa.
Sarcostroma restionis, Truncatella megaspora, T. restionacearum and T.
spadicea are newly described. New records include Pestalotiopsis
matildae, Sarcostroma lomatiae, Truncatella betulae and T. hartigii. To
resolve generic affiliations, phylogenetic analyses were performed on
ITS (ITS1, 5.8S, ITS2) and part of 28S rDNA. DNA data support the
original generic concept of Truncatella, which encompases Pestalotiopsis
species having 3-septate conidia. The genus Sarcostroma is retained as
separate from Seimatosporium.
